metadata.feature_description: Core functionality for creating and managing multi-column layouts on pages, including default layout creation and column configuration.

steps.action: Logged in as SuperUser and navigated to home page
steps.expected: Page loads with admin controls visible
steps.actual: Page loaded successfully with admin sidebar visible

steps.action: Clicked Edit button to enter edit mode
steps.expected: Page enters edit mode showing pane names and module controls
steps.actual: Edit mode activated, showing pane names (F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2, 9977_Pane1-4), Actions links, and Add Existing Module links

steps.action: Viewed full page in edit mode to see all Content Layout modules
steps.expected: All Content Layout panes visible with their contained modules
steps.actual: Full page shows 2-column layout (F30A) and 4-column layout (9977) with modules correctly placed in respective panes

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Get existing layout for a module (2-column layout)

steps.action: Hovered over Content Layout module 364 (2-column layout)
steps.expected: Column size percentages should be displayed
steps.actual: Column size indicators appeared showing 50% and 50% for each column

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Get existing layout for a module (4-column layout with custom sizes)

steps.action: Hovered over Content Layout module 365 (4-column layout)
steps.expected: Column size percentages should be displayed showing custom sizes
steps.actual: Column size indicators appeared showing custom sizes: 33%, 17%, 25%, 25%

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify column sizes are properly saved

steps.action: Verified column sizes via DOM inspection using browser evaluation
steps.expected: Inline styles should reflect saved column percentages
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed: F30A_Pane1 width=13%, F30A_Pane2 width=87%, 9977_Pane1 width=33%, 9977_Pane2 width=17%, 9977_Pane3 width=25%, 9977_Pane4 width=25%

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify CSS classes are generated correctly

steps.action: Inspected DOM to verify CSS classes on Content Layout panes
steps.expected: Bootstrap responsive grid classes should be applied to panes
steps.actual: 2-column layout panes have classes 'pane col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-12'. 4-column layout panes have classes 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12'. All panes include responsive mobile class col-xs-12.

steps.action: Verified layout structure and content placement in columns
steps.expected: Content should be displayed in correct columns according to layout
steps.actual: 2-column layout displays Test Content in left pane and WEARABLES/TABLETS/TELEVISIONS in right pane. 4-column layout displays HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, CAMERAS across four columns.

steps.action: Verified pane naming follows prefix pattern from LayoutPanePrefixGenerator
steps.expected: Panes should have unique prefix IDs
steps.actual: Panes follow the pattern: F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2 (for module 364) and 9977_Pane1, 9977_Pane2, 9977_Pane3, 9977_Pane4 (for module 365). Prefixes are unique per module instance.

observations: Code review shows CreateDefaultLayout uses Constants.DefaultColumnSizes when layout has no existing column configuration
The AreCustomColumnSizes property tracks whether column sizes have been customized by user (affects whether inline styles are applied)
Layout supports Page Versioning integration through IVersionableControl interface and VersionController
CSS classes are generated via ColumnSizesHelper.GenerateCssClasses() based on column size values
Edit mode layout editor functionality (LayoutEditor.js) provides interactive column resizing with visual percentage indicators
Bootstrap responsive grid classes ensure mobile-friendly behavior with col-xs-12 fallback
